tool.name: ImmunoPheno Panel Design
tool.description: Designs an optimal antibody panel for a target cell type

param.name: target_ids
param.label: Target Cell Ontology IDs
param.help: Enter one or more full Cell Ontology IDs (e.g., CL:0000940), separated by spaces or on new lines.

param.name: background_ids
param.label: Background Cell Ontology IDs (Optional)
param.help: Enter Cell Ontology IDs for populations to distinguish against (e.g., CL:0000236), separated by spaces or on new lines.

param.name: tissue_ids
param.label: Tissue Brenda Ontology IDs (Optional)
param.help: Restrict the search to specific tissues by providing one or more BTO IDs (e.g., BTO:0000141), separated by spaces or on new lines.

param.name: imputation
param.label: Imputation Tuning Factor
param.help: Increase if insufficient antibodies are present. Decrease if insufficient cells are present.

tool.help:
This tool uses the `optimal_antibody_panel` function from the ImmunoPheno package to design a gating strategy for isolating target cell populations.
**Inputs**
- **Target Cell Ontology IDs:** Provide one or more full CL IDs (e.g., `CL:0000940`) for the cell types you want to isolate. - **Panel Size:** The number of antibodies to include in the panel. - **Background IDs (Optional):** Provide CL IDs for cell types you want to explicitly gate *against*. - **Tissue IDs (Optional):** Provide one or more Brenda Tissue Ontology (BTO) IDs (e.g., `BTO:0000141`) to restrict the search to data from specific tissues.
**Outputs**
1. A CSV table of the recommended antibodies and their importance. 2. A PNG plot showing the gates. 3. A PNG plot of the decision tree corresponding to the gating strategies 4. A JSON file with the detailed gating path, purity, and yield statistics.
